repo_notes.content: Focus on architectural description as well as code. Subsystems and modules should be described in why they do what they do, as opposed to just how to interface with them on a functional basis.

pages.title: Overview
pages.purpose: Introduce epiworld: a C++ header-only library for fast agent-based epidemiological modeling, covering its purpose, features, and design philosophy

page_notes.content: Include the date of generation, or the latest commit hash.

pages.title: Getting Started
pages.purpose: Installation, basic setup, and hello world example showing how to run a simple SIR simulation

pages.title: System Architecture
pages.purpose: High-level overview of how Model, Agent, Virus, Tool, Entity, and Database components fit together

pages.title: Core Components
pages.purpose: Detailed documentation of the fundamental building blocks of the simulation engine

pages.title: Model Class
pages.purpose: The central orchestrator that manages simulation state, runs the main loop, and coordinates all components

pages.title: Agent Class
pages.purpose: Individual entities in the simulation with states, viruses, tools, neighbors, and entity memberships

pages.title: Virus Class
pages.purpose: Disease definitions with transmission, recovery, death, incubation parameters, and mutation capabilities

pages.title: Tool Class
pages.purpose: Interventions like vaccines and masks that modify susceptibility, transmission, recovery, and mortality

pages.title: Entity Class
pages.purpose: Agent groupings for households, schools, workplaces, and other population structures

pages.title: Database and Metrics
pages.purpose: Recording simulation history, state transitions, reproductive numbers, and other epidemiological metrics

pages.title: Pre-built Models
pages.purpose: Ready-to-use epidemiological model implementations ranging from basic to specialized

pages.title: Basic Compartmental Models
pages.purpose: SIS, SIR, and SEIR models for simple epidemic dynamics

pages.title: Models with Mortality
pages.purpose: SIRD, SISD, and SEIRD models that include death as a distinct outcome

pages.title: Connected Population Models
pages.purpose: Well-mixed population variants (SIRCONN, SEIRDCONN, etc.) without explicit networks

pages.title: Mixing Models
pages.purpose: SEIRMixing and SIRMixing with contact matrices for heterogeneous populations

pages.title: Disease-Specific Models
pages.purpose: Measles (with contact tracing and risk-based quarantine) and Surveillance models

pages.title: Network Structures
pages.purpose: Creating and managing population contact networks for agent-based models

pages.title: Graph Representation
pages.purpose: AdjList class and adjacency list data structure for efficient neighbor access

pages.title: Random Graph Generation
pages.purpose: Generating Bernoulli, ring lattice, Watts-Strogatz small-world, and blocked networks

pages.title: Network Rewiring
pages.purpose: Degree-preserving rewiring algorithms for dynamic network structures

pages.title: Running Simulations
pages.purpose: Executing models, controlling simulation flow, and managing output

pages.title: Simulation Execution
pages.purpose: Using run() and run_multiple() methods, including parallel execution with OpenMP

pages.title: Event System
pages.purpose: Event queuing and execution mechanism for consistent state changes across agents

pages.title: Data Output and Visualization
pages.purpose: Printing results, writing data files, and generating Mermaid diagrams

pages.title: Queuing Optimization
pages.purpose: Performance optimization through selective agent activation based on infection status

pages.title: Advanced Features
pages.purpose: Sophisticated analysis tools and specialized capabilities beyond basic simulation

pages.title: LFMCMC Parameter Inference
pages.purpose: Likelihood-free Markov Chain Monte Carlo for calibrating models to observed data

pages.title: Generation Intervals
pages.purpose: Computing and analyzing generation time distributions for epidemic characterization

pages.title: Contact Tracing and Quarantine
pages.purpose: Implementing contact tracing, risk stratification, and isolation strategies

pages.title: Population Mixing Patterns
pages.purpose: Using contact matrices to model heterogeneous mixing between population groups
